cards.name: Ambush Commander
cards.text:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.original_text:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Allosaurus Rider
cards.text:
You may exile two green cards from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of lands you control.
cards.original_text:
You may remove two green cards in your hand from the game rather than pay Allosaurus Rider's mana cost.
Allosaurus Rider's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of lands you control.

rulings.text: Paying the alternative cost doesn't change when you can cast the spell. A creature spell you cast this way, for example, can still only be cast during your main phase while the stack is empty.
You may pay the alternative cost rather than the card's mana cost. Any additional costs are paid as normal.
If you don't have two cards of the right color in your hand, you can't choose to cast the spell using the alternative cost.
You can't exile a card from your hand to pay for itself. At the time you would pay costs, that card is on the stack, not in your hand.

cards.name: Elvish Eulogist
cards.text: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.

rulings.text: By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

cards.name: Elvish Harbinger
cards.text:
When Elvish Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.original_text:
When Elvish Harbinger comes into play, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Elvish Warrior
cards.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

cards.name: Gempalm Strider
cards.text:
Cycling {2}{G}{G} ({2}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Strider, Elf creatures get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.original_text:
Cycling {2}{G}{G} ({2}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Strider, all Elf creatures get +2/+2 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.name: Heedless One
cards.text:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Channel your vitality through me."
cards.original_text:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves in play.

cards.name: Imperious Perfect
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
cards.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
cards.original_text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token into play.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.original_text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
cards.text: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
cards.flavor: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.
cards.original_text: Whenever you play an Elf spell, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token into play.

rulings.text: Lys Alana Huntmaster's ability will resolve before the Elf spell that caused it to trigger.

cards.name: Stonewood Invoker
cards.text: {7}{G}: Stonewood Invoker gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Mirari pulses in his veins.
cards.original_text: {7}{G}: Stonewood Invoker gets +5/+5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sylvan Messenger
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
When Sylvan Messenger enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Elf cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.original_text:
Trample
When Sylvan Messenger comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Elf cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Timberwatch Elf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Even through the Mirari's voice, the elves still hear the call of their kinship.
cards.original_text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves in play.

rulings.text: The number of Elves on the battlefield is counted only as Timberwatch Elf's ability resolves. If Timberwatch Elf is still on the battlefield, it'll count itself.

cards.name: Voice of the Woods
cards.text: Tap five untapped Elves you control: Create a 7/7 green Elemental creature token with trample.
cards.flavor: The ritual of making draws upon the elves' memories and pasts. And elves have long memories and ancient pasts.
cards.original_text: Tap five untapped Elves you control: Put a 7/7 green Elemental creature token with trample into play.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.name: Wellwisher
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Close your ears to the voice of greed, and you can turn a gift for one into a gift for many."
cards.original_text: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf in play.

cards.name: Wirewood Herald
cards.text: When Wirewood Herald dies, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The goblins laughed as the elf ran away, until more came back.
cards.original_text: When Wirewood Herald is put into a graveyard from play, you may search your library for an Elf card. If you do, reveal that card and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Wirewood Symbiote
cards.text: Return an Elf you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: It drinks fatigue.
cards.original_text: Return an Elf you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.
cards.original_text: When Wood Elves comes into play, search your library for a Forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Wren's Run Vanquisher
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, reveal an Elf card from your hand or pay {3}.
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.original_text:
As an additional cost to play Wren's Run Vanquisher, reveal an Elf card from your hand or pay {3}.
Deathtouch (Whenever this creature deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature.)

cards.name: Elvish Promenade
cards.text: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token for each Elf you control.
cards.flavor: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.
cards.original_text: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token into play for each Elf you control.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.original_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Harmonize
cards.text: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor:
"Life's greatest lessons don't come from focus or concentration. They come from breathing and simply noticing."
—Seton, centaur druid
cards.original_text: Draw three cards.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Concentrate.

cards.name: Wildsize
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Two times the size, four times the smell.
cards.original_text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Moonglove Extract
cards.text: Sacrifice Moonglove Extract: It deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Diluted, moonglove can etch living tissue. Concentrated, a drop will kill a giant.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Moonglove Extract: Moonglove Extract deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Slate of Ancestry
cards.text: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: The pattern of life can be studied like a book, if you know how to read it.
cards.original_text: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{G}, {T}: Untap target Elf.
cards.original_text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: Untap target Elf.

cards.name: Tranquil Thicket
cards.text:
Tranquil Thicket enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
Cycling {G} ({G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.original_text:
Tranquil Thicket comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Cycling {G} ({G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Siege-Gang Commander
cards.text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.original_text:
When Siege-Gang Commander comes into play, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander's activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.

cards.name: Akki Coalflinger
cards.text:
First strike
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: No matter where you find them, goblins love rocks.
cards.original_text:
First strike
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Clickslither
cards.text:
Haste
Sacrifice a Goblin: Clickslither gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The least popular goblins get the outer caves.
cards.original_text:
Haste
Sacrifice a Goblin: Clickslither gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Emberwilde Augur
cards.text: Sacrifice Emberwilde Augur: It deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: Legends say a djinn gave the goblins a gift they could never hope to master.
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Emberwilde Augur: Emberwilde Augur deals 3 damage to target player. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Flamewave Invoker
cards.text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.
cards.original_text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Gempalm Incinerator
cards.text:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
cards.original_text:
Cycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Gempalm Incinerator, you may have it deal X damage to target creature, where X is the number of Goblins in play.

rulings.text: The target of the ability can't be a creature with Protection from Creatures, with Protection from Goblins, or with Protection from Red.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.name: Goblin Cohort
cards.text: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've cast a creature spell this turn.
cards.flavor: Akki shells provided good protection when downhill charging became headlong tumbling.
cards.original_text: Goblin Cohort can't attack unless you've played a creature spell this turn.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: There's always room for one more.
cards.original_text: When Goblin Matron comes into play, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Ringleader
cards.text:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.original_text:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Goblin Sledder
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let's play 'sled.' Here's how it works: you're the sled."
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.text:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblins you control have haste.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.
cards.original_text:
Goblin spells you play cost {1} less to play.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.

rulings.text: Goblin Warchief's effect reduces only generic mana in the cost of Goblin spells you cast. For example, it doesn't reduce the cost of Skirk Prospector below {R}.

cards.name: Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician
cards.text:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "Everybody but me—CHARGE!"
cards.original_text:
Whenever another Goblin you control becomes blocked, sacrifice it. If you do, it deals 4 damage to each creature blocking it.
Sacrifice two Mountains: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.

rulings.text: If you don't actually sacrifice the Goblin (because it was removed from the battlefield before the ability resolved, for example), no damage is dealt.

cards.name: Mogg Fanatic
cards.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"
cards.original_text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it's too late to activate its ability before it's destroyed.

cards.name: Mogg War Marshal
cards.text:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal enters the battlefield or dies, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.
cards.original_text:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal comes into play or is put into a graveyard from play, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token into play.

cards.name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
cards.text: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.
cards.original_text: When Mudbutton Torchrunner is put into a graveyard from play, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.original_text: Haste

cards.name: Reckless One
cards.text:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Release chaos with me!"
cards.original_text:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins in play.

cards.name: Skirk Drill Sergeant
cards.text: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "I order you to volunteer."
cards.original_text: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it into play. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Skirk Fire Marshal
cards.text:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: He's boss because he's smart enough to get out of the way.
cards.original_text:
Protection from red
Tap five untapped Goblins you control: Skirk Fire Marshal deals 10 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.name: Skirk Prospector
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R}.
cards.flavor:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.original_text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Skirk Shaman
cards.text: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.
cards.flavor: In a shaman's grimy hands, a concoction of dried Skirk Ridge herbs can become the face of panic.
cards.original_text: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Severed Legion.

cards.name: Tar Pitcher
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Auntie Grub had caught a goat, a bleating doe that still squirmed in her arms. At the same time, her warren decided to share with her a sensory greeting of hot tar . . . ."
—A tale of Auntie Grub
cards.original_text: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Boggart Shenanigans
cards.text: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Boggarts revel in discovering new sensations, from the texture of an otter pellet to the squeak of a dying warren mate.
cards.original_text: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from play, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"Within each of you is the strength of a landslide."
—Kumano, to his pupils
cards.original_text: Spitting Earth deals damage equal to the number of Mountains you control to target creature.

cards.name: Tarfire
cards.text: Tarfire deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"After Auntie brushed the soot from her eyes, she discovered something wonderful: the fire had turned the goat into something that smelled delicious."
—A tale of Auntie Grub
cards.original_text: Tarfire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
